title: About Us
content:
How We Got Started

The African Christian Business Fellowship is an enduring non-profit organization, legally recognised with the capacity to own assets, establish entitlements, undertake commitments and initiate or respond to legal actions in its distinct name.

Our Story

Started in 1994 by Archbishop Dr Ezekiel H. Guti out of a burden after observing many Christian business people struggling and failing to run their businesses and losing properties including houses after failing to pay back loans. Many Christian business people were going to him seeking counselling on family relationships that were being negatively affected by failing businesses.

From this, Archbishop Dr Ezekiel H. Guti was moved by God to teach business people on how to run Godly businesses, that bring joy at home and success. This became the start of ACBF.

Our Objectives

1

To offer consultative work.

2

To be involved in charitable work.

3

To establish a Christian Business Fund.

4

To help those who are starting their businesses.

5

To meet the spiritual needs of business people.

6

To help those who are having problems managing their businesses.

7

To raise funds by providing, or encouraging sales of work.

8

To organize lectures, seminars calculated to benefit the organization.

9

To fulfil the great commission, and to win other business people to Christ.

10

To provide a network of business people for the coordination of activities, and exchange of information.

11

To invest any monies of the organization which shall be held for the purpose of the organization.

12

To sponsor and coordinate conferences, and other activities that bring Christian business people together with a view to enhancing the international character of business people.

13

To establish a network of Christian business people all over Africa, and all nations based on biblical principles, and without losing contact with their creator, Genesis 24:1 - Abraham was rich, but did not lose contact with God.
